title: Strictly Come Dancing's Oti Mabuse and Kelvin Fletcher arrive in Manchester for rehearsals
text:
They've been hailed the 'perfect match' by fans as they continue to impress both the judges and viewers with their showstopping performances.

And Strictly Come Dancing stars Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse cut casual figures as they arrived in Manchester to train for the show on Tuesday.

The Emmerdale actor, 35, sported a navy hoodie and matching tracksuit bottoms with white trainers as he rolled a suitcase through the city.

Out and about: Strictly Come Dancing stars Kelvin Fletcher, 35, and Oti Mabuse, 29, cut casual figures as they arrived in Manchester to train for the show on Tuesday

Professional dancer Oti, 29, looked stylish in a camel coat which she paired with black leggings and a large leopard print scarf.

Letting her brunette locks fall loose down her shoulders, the TV star carried a white handbag and also sported a pair of spectacles.

Kelvin and Oti turned out another stellar performance in Halloween Week where they scored 36 out of 40 for their tango.

The pair will be dancing the Viennese waltz to Say Something by A Great Big World and Christina Aguilera in this week's show.

Casual: The Emmerdale actor sported a navy hoodie and matching tracksuit bottoms with white trainers as he rolled a suitcase through the city

Their outing comes after Kelvin shirked off any 'Strictly curse' rumours with Oti as he shared a sweet photo of his wife Liz and 10-month-old son Milo.

The actor praised his childhood sweetheart in the caption as he called her a 'wonder woman' followed by a heart emoji.

In the sweet snap, Liz looked radiant as she beamed to the camera in a white jumper while Milo, who wore an adorable red hoodie and star bib, smiled too.

Kelvin's 231,000 followers were quick to react to the post with Michelle Keegan sharing a heart and heart eyes emoji while Oti's sister Motsi Mabuse, who is a judge on Strictly, posted two hearts underneath.

Outfit: Professional dancer Oti looked stylish in a camel coat which she paired with black leggings and a large leopard print scarf

The actor also revealed that he had a 'bring your family to work day' at his rehearsals as he shared fun videos of Liz, Milo and their three-year-old daughter Marnie.

Narrating over the clips shared to his Instagram story, Kelvin said that Liz was watching him dance and making sure he was doing alright.

He then joked: 'It's bring your family to work today, it's not really, as I was saying bye to the kids, this little monkey didn't want to leave me. They've come to rehearse with me.'

The post comes after Kelvin revealed last month that he wants viewers to believe that he is in love with his professional dancer partner Oti as he teased the show's 'curse'.

Sweet: Kelvin shirked off any Strictly Come Dancing curse rumours with Oti as he recently shared a sweet photo of his wife Liz and 10-month-old son Milo

The Emmerdale star and his dance partner wowed fans with a very steamy samba during the first live show where they topped the leader board.

Kelvin admitted that part of the allure of the show is guessing if their is a romance going on between the celebrities and their professional counterparts.

During an interview with The Sun, Kelvin revealed that spending long hours in close proximity leaves fans wondering whether there is romantic chemistry between the dance couples.

Impressive moves: They've been hailed the 'perfect match' by fans as they continue to succeed in the BBC One dance competition (Kelvin pictured with Oti in September)

He revealed: 'Why else do we watch Strictly? You've got these people and they have to look so majestic and beautiful and endearing and the story looks like, "Oh there's something going on there".

'Two strangers spend ten hours a day together, connected by the hip, naturally touching and very close — nose to nose. There's a lot of signals there of what people will be looking at.'

Kelvin added that he hopes fans see 'whatever narrative it is' with himself and Oti, suggesting that it could even be that they are 'in love' as he wants viewers to 'believe it'.
description: They've been hailed the 'perfect match' by fans as they continue to impress both the judges and viewers with their showstopping performances on the BBC series.
